text: The men's VL2 competition at the 2019 ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships in Szeged took place at the Olympic Centre of Szeged. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Wednesday 21 August 2019 || 16:25 || Heats |- | rowspan=3|Thursday 22 August 2019 || 11:20 || Semifinals |- | 16:20 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 16:30 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== Heat winners advanced directly to the A final. The next six fastest boats in each heat advanced to the semifinals. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Name !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=bbffbb | 1 | align="left"|Norberto Mourão | align="left"| | 52.40 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 2 | align="left"|Jakub Tokarz | align="left"| | 52.47 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 3 | align="left"|Róbert Suba | align="left"| | 53.35 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 4 | align="left"|Igor Alex Tofalini | align="left"| | 54.46 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 5 | align="left"|Andrei Tkachuk | align="left"| | 56.85 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 6 | align="left"|Eslam Jahedi | align="left"| | 58.27 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 7 | align="left"|Takanori Kato | align="left"| | 1:00.94 | |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Name !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=bbffbb | 1 | align="left"|Tamás Juhász | align="left"| | 53.28 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 2 | align="left"|Roman Serebryakov | align="left"| | 53.33 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 3 | align="left"|Igor Korobeynikov | align="left"| | 53.42 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 4 | align="left"|Stewart Clark | align="left"| | 54.91 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 5 | align="left"|Mathieu St-Pierre | align="left"| | 56.36 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 6 | align="left"|Oleksandr Suprun | align="left"| | 58.38 | |} ====Heat 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Name !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=bbffbb | 1 | align="left"|Luis Carlos da Silva | align="left"| | 51.95 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 2 | align="left"|Marius-Bogdan Ciustea | align="left"| | 54.40 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 3 | align="left"|Higinio Rivero | align="left"| | 54.61 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 4 | align="left"|Blake Haxton | align="left"| | 56.46 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 5 | align="left"|Ilya Taupianets | align="left"| | 59.20 | |-bgcolor=ddffdd | 6 | align="left"|Gajendra Singh | align="left"| | 1:06.73 | |} ===Semifinals=== Qualification was as follows: The fastest three boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The next four fastest boats in each semi, plus the fastest remaining boat advanced to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Name !Country !Time !Notes
